items.title: Live: Three people, including child, missing as Longwood fire destroys homes and property in Victoria
items.description: Multiple out-of-control bushfires are threatening dozens of towns in central and north-eastern Victoria, with hot temperatures and strong winds resulting in "catastrophic" fire conditions. Follow live.

items.title: Weather system brews 'perfect storm' for abnormally intense heatwave
items.description: Southern states continue to sweat through one of the most intense heatwaves on record, and for many regions, including Melbourne and Sydney, the hottest weather is still to come.

items.title: Track temperatures live as southern states bake in heatwave
items.description: Use our tracker to keep an eye on temperatures as a heatwave moves through the southern states.

items.title: Calling a royal commission is just the start of Albanese's leadership test
items.description: The prime minister's critics feel he failed to meet the moment in the immediate aftermath of the Bondi attack, but with the royal commission he has a chance to get it right.

items.title: US federal agents shoot two people in Portland, police say
items.description: US Border Patrol agents were conducting a vehicle stop Tuesday in Portland, Oregon when the driver "weaponised" the vehicle before an officer "fired a defensive shot", according to the Department of Homeland Security.

items.title: FBI accused of barring local authorities from Minnesota ICE shooting investigation
items.description: The shooting claimed the life of 37-year-old mother-of-three Renee Nicole Good, and has prompted protests and heated political debate.

items.title: Diana received a tip to flee Venezuela. She was on a list to be arrested
items.description: When a Telegram message landed on her phone, Diana knew she had to flee Venezuela. It was from someone close to Nicolás Maduro, and she says she would have been jailed, or worse.

items.title: Inside Maduro's network of alleged drug traffickers wanted by the US
items.description: The deposed Venezuelan president allegedly oversaw a network of associates to facilitate the flow of illegal drugs into the US, aided by false passports, a guerilla training school, jets and grenade launchers.

items.title: In Greenland, Trump's talk of annexation is stirring up a dark past
items.description: The United States has a long history of wanting to acquire Greenland, but people living on the island say Donald Trump's latest comments about annexation feel different.

items.title: Trump warns Iran will 'pay hell' if protesters are killed amid internet outage
items.description: Human rights groups say more than 40 people have been killed in protest-related violence since last month.

items.title: Routine flight to WA mining town leaves man facing life-or-death scenario
items.description: Pilbara resident Andrew Rawle found himself 30,000 feet in the air, unable to breathe due to anaphylactic shock, but was saved by the crew and the selfless act of another passenger.

items.title: 'Our world changed': Matildas star returns home to face family tragedy
items.description: Arsenal's Australia international Kyra Cooney-Cross flies back to Australia to be with her mother, who has been diagnosed with stage-four cancer.

items.title: What landlords are obliged to do to cool your rental property
items.description: With the nation gripped by a heatwave, renters will be looking at their rights for cooling their homes. Here's what they can do.

items.title: 'How rude can I be?' RBA deputy gets candid on inflation and rates
items.description: The Reserve Bank says inflation is "too high", but that doesn't mean it will necessarily rush to raise interest rates next month.

items.title: Live: Rio Tinto stock tumbles on mega merger talks, dragging down ASX
items.description: Glencore has confirmed media speculation that the company is back in merger talks with Rio Tinto. Follow updates live on our business and finance blog.

items.title: Rio Tinto in merger talks with Glencore but total takeover not the only option
items.description: Rio Tinto and Glencore are in takeover talks that could potentially lead to a combined mega miner worth more than $US200 billion. Analysts are questioning whether Rio will be interested in Glencore's coal assets, having sold off its own in 2018.

items.title: With five Emmys and two Golden Globes noms, everyone's loving The Pitt
items.description: ER launched Noah Wyle's career in 1994. Thirty years later he's back in the emergency room — and scooping awards season — as Dr Robby in The Pitt.

items.title: Teagan Croft will play Rapunzel in Disney's Tangled. Here's what we know
items.description: Australian actress Teagan Croft will take on the lead role of Rapunzel in Disney's Tangled. The 21-year-old will star alongside Milo Manheim in the live-action remake.

items.title: Kyrgios says he will not be seeking an Aus Open wildcard
items.description: Returning from injury, Nick Kyrgios has spoken with Australian Open organisers and made the call not to use a wildcard to play singles this year.

items.title: 'Airport brain': The weird things Aussie travellers leave behind every year
items.description: From tablets, headphones and laptops, to prams, vacuum cleaners and even a prosthetic leg — these are the items being left behind each year at major airports.

items.title: How the internet reacted to Australia's victory in the fifth Ashes Test
items.description: The internet went wild as Australia dominated with the bat, led by Travis Head and Steve Smith, and England crumbled in the dying embers of the Ashes.

items.title: 'Vitally important' royal commission examines Bondi attack, Minns says
items.description: Community groups that lobbied for a national inquiry into antisemitism back the prime minister's announcement of a royal commission as the NSW premier pledges the NSW government's full cooperation.

items.title: From scourge to saviour: How the sun powered the grid through a heatwave
items.description: For so long, the pounding sunshine of an Australian heatwave was the grid's biggest threat. It has now become its greatest asset.

items.title: Martinelli apologises for 'disgraceful' act towards injured Liverpool player
items.description: Arsenal winger Gabriel Martinelli has apologised for shoving Liverpool's Conor Bradley, who was down with a serious knee injury, off the pitch during their Premier League clash.

items.title: As she turns 44, Princess Catherine is quietly reshaping royal life
items.description: Catherine turns 44 today as she resets royal life with fewer public appearances, tighter boundaries and a strong emphasis on family life — a choice shaped by loss, illness and the pressure of being next in line.
